definition: diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek

sentences.english: They are brewing up a wicked plot.
Team Themis's machinations were exposed before they got past the proposal stage.
sentences.chinese: 忒彌斯團隊的圖謀還在立項階段就被曝光了。

sentences.english: She schemed to keep her rivals in ignorance of her plans.
sentences.chinese: 她圖謀不讓對手知道她的計劃。

sentences.english: Tell me, why should I plot against you life?
sentences.chinese: 告訴我爲什麼我會對你的生活圖謀不軌？

sentences.english: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
sentences.chinese: 眼目緊合的，圖謀乖僻，嘴脣緊閉的，成就邪惡。

sentences.english: The PLA is ready to crash attempts to split the country.
sentences.chinese: 解放軍已嚴陣以待，粉碎任何分裂祖國的圖謀。

sentences.english: From you, O Nineveh , has one come forth who plots evil against the LORD and counsels wickedness.
sentences.chinese: 有一人從你那裏出來，圖謀邪惡，設惡計攻擊耶和華。

sentences.english: Those degenerates who tried in vain to split their own county will not escape from historical punishments.
sentences.chinese: 圖謀分裂國家的民族敗類，最終逃脫不了歷史的懲罰。

sentences.english: The notorious drug - pusher has been contriving an escape from the prison.
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的大毒梟一直都在圖謀越獄。

sentences.english: What's Japan's strategic intention for deploying THAAD?
sentences.chinese: 日本擬部署“薩德”有何戰略圖謀？

sentences.english: And we must learn to defend ourselves from those who want to hurt us.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須學會防着那些圖謀不軌的人。

sentences.english: Woe to them that devise iniquity, and work evil upon their beds!
sentences.chinese: 禍哉，那些在牀上圖謀罪孽，造作奸惡的。

sentences.english: She accused her boss of making advances to her.
sentences.chinese: 她指控老闆對她圖謀不軌。

sentences.english: ID seals , the only association with the manifest for cargo management .
sentences.chinese: 鉛封ID號和貨單唯一關聯，便於貨運圖謀。

sentences.english: Those men were scheming to cheat the government by bringing the jewels into the country without paying duty.
sentences.chinese: 那些人不繳關稅將珠寶帶入國境，圖謀以此誆騙政府。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
